channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed

item.title: Fallout 4 and Indiana Jones get Switch 2 release dates, Oblivion Remastered also confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Bethesda’s bringing some goodies to Nintendo Switch 2, following up on announcements last year with release dates and a shadow drop. Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition is out this month on 24th February, Indiana Jones and The Great Circle’s ambitious Switch 2 port will arrive in on 12th May, and it’s also been confirmed that The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered will arrive on Switch 2 later this year.

Fallout 4’s port to Nintendo Switch 2 ought to be the more straightforward one. Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition is an upgraded bundle of the decade old RPG, combining the base game with all its official add-ons and a curated set of 150 Creation Club game mods. This is a feature match for the PS5, Xbox Series X|S and PC version that launched last year.

While the mods will add a heftier burden to the game’s visuals (and Bethesda aren’t exactly known for the optimisation of their RPGs), we’d hope that they strike a good balance with Fallout 4. Certainly, it needs to be better than the Switch 2 launch of Skyrim, which had bags of added latency that needed hurried patches to take the worst off.

Indiana Jones and The Great Circle, though, is much more ambitious. Originally released for Xbox Series X|S and PC in December 2024, before being ported to PS5 last April, it’s a current gen game that features ray traced global illumination for its light and shadow throughout. The Switch 2 hardware does support ray tracing, but its GPU comes in shy of the minimum bar that MachineGames set for the game on PC or Series S. That said, idTech is often fantastically well-optimised for all manner of system specs, so hopefully they can sprinkle some magic dust on Nintendo’s handheld hybrid.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is out now across Xbox Series X|S, PC, and PlayStation 5. In our review of the main game I said, “Indiana Jones and the Great Circle forges its own, distinctive path as an archeological adventure, excellently capturing the feel of the films with its visuals and performances. There’s a fun new story here as well, wrapped around its blend of exploration, puzzles and pugilism.”



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2026/02/05/fallout-4-and-indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-get-switch-2-release-dates-oblivion-remastered-also-confirmed/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Pragmata and Monster Hunter Stories 3 demos drop onto Switch 2 today
item.content:encoded:
Capcom games were sprinkled through the Nintendo Direct today, the company has announced that demoes for two of their upcoming games will drop onto Nintendo Switch 2 today. If you’re curious to see what Pragmata and Monster Hunter Stories 3 are like, then you can grab a demo and find out!

It’s also been confirmed that the Pragmata demo is available across all its launch platforms, so Switch 2, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and (already) PC.

We’ve been hands on with both, starting with Monster Hunter Stories 3, which Dom was able to check out last year. He said, “Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection is the obvious next step for the series. That’s taking the graphics and the turn-based action up a notch, while expanding the world of Monster Hunter into newfound territory. The previous two games have given fans a totally different take on the mythology and magic of the series’ iconic creatures, and on early impressions alone, Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection looks as though it’s going to carry on that tradition.”

Meanwhile, I played Pragmata at a Nintendo preview event last week, coming away pretty happy with how the game’s inventive sci-fi puzzle action handled on the console. I’ve written, “Darkness hides a lot of necessary evils in Resident Evil Requiem, but playing through the Sketchbook demo on Switch 2 places Hugh and Diana in a very brightly lit, clean environment, and that doesn’t help matters. There’s maybe some fuzzy upscaling that’s noticeable, there’s 3D model detail that’s reduced far enough to be reminiscent of the moulded look that PS3 era normal mapping presented, and the like. The visual cuts were pretty clear to me when playing on TV, but hopping into the game in handheld mode helped to max them a bit more, and the game was still nice and smooth to play in both settings.”

Rounding out the previews for Capcom, there was a new trailer for Resident Evil Requiem, showcasing both Grace and Leon gameplay, as well as reconfirming that it will launch alongside ports of Resident Evil 7 and Village on 27th February.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2026/02/05/pragmata-and-monster-hunter-stories-3-demos-drop-onto-switch-2-today/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Indiana Jones Cracks His Whip On Switch 2 On 12th May 2026
item.content:encoded:
The Great Circle awaits

Looking forward to Indiana Jones and the Great Circle on the Switch 2? Well, good news, because it's finally emerging on 12th May 2026.

Developed by MachineGames of Wolfenstein fame, The Great Circle sees Indy embark on an epic adventure that takes him across Vatican City, Giza, the Himalaya Mountains, and more. Blending first-person action with some neat stealth elements, it's a genuinely great game, and we sincerely hope it translates well to the Switch 2.

Breaking news...

Nintendo Life’s resident horror fanatic, when he’s not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Pragmata Lands April Release Date And A New Switch 2 Demo
item.content:encoded:
No Cap(com)

Capcom popped up at the Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase to reveal Pragmata's Switch 2 release date: 24th April 2026.

The Switch 2 footage looked pretty strong, too. Everything seemed to be running at a solid 60fps, which is a welcome sight given how combat-heavy this one appears.

If you want to see what it's all about for yourself, Pragmata is getting a Switch 2 demo! Capcom confirmed that this will be available on the eShop later today, so keep an eye out!

This story is breaking news, we will update with more information shortly...

Jim came to Nintendo Life in 2022 and, despite his insistence that The Minish Cap is the best Zelda game and his unwavering love for the Star Wars prequels (yes, really), he has continued to write news and features on the site ever since.

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth Arrives on Nintendo Switch 2 This June
item.content:encoded:
After it was rumoured to appear during today's Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase, once the showcase started, it didn't take too long for Final Fantasy VII Rebirth to appear, with a new trailer showcasing the second entry in the FFVII Remake Trilogy on Nintendo Switch 2, and a release date, with it arriving almost precisely as predicted: on June 3, 2026.

Two weeks ago, the reliable insider NateTheHate pointed to Final Fantasy VII Rebirth arriving on Nintendo Switch 2 and Xbox Series X/S sometime this year. Following that, yesterday, ahead of today's Partner Showcase, NateTheHate pointed to Rebirth appearing at today's showcase, as it supported a theory they have regarding how Square Enix will begin its marketing campaign for Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3.

Well, NateTheHate was absolutely right about everything so far. Not only did Rebirth appear during the Partner Showcase, but it was also given a release date, which, as he predicted, falls in June, in close proximity to Summer Game Fest.

For Final Fantasy fans who only have a Nintendo Switch 2 available to them and haven't been able to play any of the games in the Final Fantasy VII Remake trilogy so far, this is great news. Now that Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade is on Nintendo Switch 2, those players can look forward to jumping into Rebirth when it arrives on Switch 2 this June.

For all other Final Fantasy fans that have already rinsed Remake Intergrade and Rebirth on other platforms, this hopefully means that NateTheHate is also correct about his prediction that, at Summer Game Fest 2026, we'll get our first look at the conclusion of the remake trilogy, which will also hopefully be a multiplatform release.

Speaking of other platforms, the only thing left unclear at the time of this writing is the arrival of Final Fantasy VII Rebirth on Xbox Series X/S. Presumably, it'll arrive on June 3, 2026, alongside the Nintendo Switch 2 edition, just like how Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade arrived on both Switch 2 and Xbox Series X/S at the same time. For now, Rebirth's Xbox Series release date has yet to be confirmed. We'll update this article when that information goes live.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/final-fantasy-vii-rebirth-arrives-on-nintendo-switch-2-this-june/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase February 2026 - All the News and Announcements
item.content:encoded:
Today, Nintendo held a brand new Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase that contained around 30 minutes of information about upcoming Switch 2 and Switch titles. Here's everything that was announced during the show!

Orbitals still looks like cute anime co-op fun

We begin the presentation with a quick look at upcoming anime co-op game Orbitals, which looks like it wants to hoover up the It Takes Two and Split Fiction crowd. It looks cute! You can play it on Switch 2 this summer.

Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse brings visual novel scares to Switch

Visual novel adventure Paranormasight: The Seven Mysteries of Honjo is getting a followup, and this one's got some more active underwater exploration sequences for you as well. Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse comes to Switch on February 19th.

Captain Tsubasa 2: World Fighters is for Inazuma Eleven fans

Do you like Inazuma Eleven's combination of anime and soccer? If so, then you're going to love Captain Tsubasa 2: World Fighters, which is coming to Switch sometime this year.

Tokyo Scramble is a dino hide-and-seek horror game

In Tokyo Scramble, you won't be able to fight the horrifying dinosaur-like Zino enemies, so protagonist Anne's best option is to run, hide, and distract her enemies. This one's coming to Switch 2 on February 11th.

Hey, Valheim is getting a Switch 2 port

If you haven't already had your fill of Valheim, you'll be pleased to know that it's coming to Switch 2 in all of its Viking survival glory. It's launching sometime this year.

Hollow Knight: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is coming later today

Looking for an excuse to replay the original Hollow Knight after Silksong? You won't need to wait much longer, as the Switch 2 version of the game is coming later today, and it's free if you own the original!

eFootball Kick-Off! brings Pro Evolution Soccer to Switch 2

Konami's answer to EA's EA Sports FC series (formerly known as FIFA) is coming to Switch 2, giving you even more options to play the beautiful game. This one's arriving in summer.

The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales looks strange indeed

Taking place across four ages, The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales is a gorgeous-looking HD-2D game that should be perfect for those who wish Chrono Trigger was a bit more active. It's landing on June 18th.

Super Bomberman Collection brings retro goodness

Packing in a bunch of Bomberman games for your enjoyment, Super Bomberman Collection hits both Switch 2 and Switch later today, so gather some friends and get ready to blow stuff up.

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is coming to Switch 2

Hey, who'd have thunk? Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, the second part of the Final Fantasy VII Remake series, is arriving on Switch 2, so you can follow the next step of this occasionally-incomprehensible journey on June 3rd. Let's hope it looks as good as its predecessor!

Pragmata is definitely one of Capcom's weirder games

Looking absolutely gorgeous and smooth on Switch 2, Capcom's Pragmata is definitely one of the studio's stranger outings, and you can expect it to hit Switch 2 on April 24th. A demo is coming today as well.

Turok: Origins is a dino origin story for one or several players

Next up, it's Saber Interactive's Turok: Origins, a dino origin story that will see you taking down dinosaurs and other critters either solo or as part of a squad. You can also switch between first-person and third-person views. This one's launching in fall.

Kyoto Xanadu is a Tokyo Xanadu followup with plenty of anime vibes

Academies for gifted students, high-tech labyrinths, and achingly anime designs: Kyoto Xanadu's got it all, and it blends 2D exploration with 3D combat in an interesting-looking way. You can check this one out on Switch 2 and Switch in summer.

Digimon Story Time Stranger gives you options on Switch 2

Digimon fans, this one's for you. The latest JRPG in the Digimon Story series, Time Stranger, is coming to Switch 2 and Switch, and you can choose to play at 4K and 30fps or 1080p and 60fps (if you're on Switch 2, that is). Mark July 10th in your calendar for this one.

Granblue Fantasy: Relink - Endless Ragnarok is a port, I think?

It looks as though Granblue Fantasy: Relink - Endless Ragnarok is a port of the successful action RPG for Switch 2 rather than a spinoff, but either way, it's coming to Switch 2 on July 9th.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection offers more cute JRPG action

We already knew about this one, but it's a nice opportunity to get another look at the adorable JRPG action of Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection, which is landing on Switch 2 on March 13th. A demo is coming today.

Arcade Archives 2 brings more retro goodness soon, and there's a surprise too

Arcade Archives 2 is getting a new retro title in the form of Rave Racer on February 26th, and a new project called Console Archives was also announced, reviving retro classics like Doraemon, Sonic Wings Special, and Cool Boarders, among others. They're coming later today.

It's sizzle reel time!

Next up, we got to see a sizzle reel of some upcoming Switch 2 games, and here they are!

  • Scott Pilgrim EX (March 3rd - Switch 2 and Switch)
  • Another Eden Begins (Summer 2026 - Switch 2 and Switch)
  • Reanimal (February 13th - Switch 2)
  • WWE 2K26 (March 13th - Switch 2)
  • Star Trek: Voyager - Across the Unknown (February 18th - Switch 2)
  • Disney Dreamlight Valley: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (March 25th - Switch 2)
  • PGA Tour 2K25 (February 6th - Switch 2)
  • Culdcept Begins (July 16th - Switch 2 and Switch)
  • Goat Simulator 3 (April 1st - Switch 2)
  • Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun (March 18th - Switch 2)
  • Tales of Arise - Beyond the Dawn Edition (May 22nd - Switch 2)

Resident Evil Requiem sure does still look spooky

It's still pretty amazing that Resident Evil Requiem is coming to Switch 2, but coming to Switch 2 it very much is, and hey, it looks spooky as heck. Release date for this one is February 27th, as it is for Resident Evil VII and Village on Switch 2.

Some pretty big Bethesda games are hitting Switch 2

To close out the show, Bethesda announced that it's bringing some of its biggest releases to Switch 2. Fallout 4 is hitting the console on February 24th, while Indiana Jones and the Great Circle arrives on May 12th and Oblivion Remastered is coming sometime later this year.

That's all for today, folks! Join us next time for more Nintendo Direct shenanigans.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph



https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/nintendo-direct-partner-showcase-february-2026-all-news-and-announcements
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Everything We Saw At Today’s Nintendo Partner Direct
item.content:encoded:
It’s February. The weather is cold, love is in the air, and there’s a Nintendo Direct to tune in for. Nintendo, as it often does, scheduled it for the ass crack of dawn, so if you were still sleeping or getting ready for work and missed the whole shebang, we’ve got you covered. If you want to watch the stream yourself, you can do so below, but if you just want the highlights, read on.

Orbitals

Kicking things off is Orbitals, a game often described as “anime Split Fiction.” The co-op puzzle game sports a retro anime aesthetic and has two players doing co-op-centric puzzles, platforming, and a ton of mini-games. It’s coming to Switch 2 this summer and will support Game Share, so you’ll only need one copy of the game to play with a friend.

Paranormasight: The Mermaid’s Curse

Next up is the next entry in the Paranormasight series.  The mystery adventure series is going to an island setting where you’ll solve puzzles and a larger mystery. It’s coming out on February 19.

Captain Tsubasa II World Fighters

If you’ve ever wanted to live out a sports anime, the latest entry in the Captain Tsubasa series is giving you that chance with its extreme soccer action. It’s coming to Switch later this year.

Tokyo Scramble

Tokyo Scramble is a horror game in which you run around a subterranean world beneath Tokyo while trying to avoid dinosaurs, sometimes activating traps to hinder them. You can play alongside friends by splitting the game’s controls across multiple systems such that one person controls character movement, another steers the camera, and so on. That sounds…frustrating but in a way that would probably make for a good livestream. It’s coming to Switch 2 February 11.

Valheim

Survival game Valheim is coming to Nintendo Switch 2 after being just about everywhere else for years. It’ll arrive on the system later this year.

Hollow Knight: Switch 2 Edition

If you want to play the original Hollow Knight on the go with better framerate, it’s coming to Switch 2 today. If you have the Switch version, you can upgrade for free.

eFootball Kick-Off!

And we’re back to soccer with eFootball Kick-Off!, Konami’s evolution of its legendary PES soccer series, which is coming to Switch 2 this summer.

The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales

The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales is the next HD-2D RPG coming from Square, and it looks pretty despite the silly name. It’s coming to Switch 2 on June 18.

Super Bomberman Collection

If you’re feeling nostalgic and want to play all five Bomberman games released on the SNES, including ones that weren’t released worldwide up until now, the Super Bomberman Collection is coming to Switch and Switch 2 today.

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth

The second game in the Final Fantasy VII Remake trilogy is coming to Switch 2, so you, too, can play a whole bunch of mini-games and be annoyed by the ending on the go. It’s coming to Switch 2 on June 3.

Pragmata

Capcom’s new sci-fi puzzle shooter Pragmata is coming to Switch 2, and what I played of it last year makes it seem like it’s going to be pretty cool in a kind of nostalgic Xbox-360-era shooter sort of way. It’s coming to Switch 2 on April 24, and a demo is available today.

Turok: Origins

If one dinosaur game was not enough for you or you want one that’s gonna be a bit more action and a bit less running away, Turok: Origins is bringing all that to Switch 2 in the fall.

Kyoto Xanadu

Kyoto Xanadu is a cross between hack-and-slash and sidescrolling action and Persona-style social sim. It’s coming to Switch and Switch 2 this summer.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger

Oh hell yeah, Digimon Story: Time Stranger is coming to Switch 2 and Switch. It’s a great turn-based RPG that I probably would’ve preferred playing on this system the first time around. It’s coming to Nintendo systems on July 10.

Granblue Fantasy: Relink – Endless Ragnarok

The latest entry in the Granblue Fantasy action RPG series is coming to the Switch 2 on July 9.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection

If you’ve ever been interested in Monster Hunter but find its dense systems intimidating, the Monster Hunter Stories subseries is probably a better entry point. The next entry, Twisted Reflection, is coming to Switch 2 on March 13, and a demo is coming out today. If you play it, you can transfer your save data to the full game when it launches.

Arcade Archives / Console Archives

New games are coming to Arcade Archives and Console Archives, including Rave Racer, Doraemon, Sonic Wings Special, Cool Boarders, and Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos. 

Montage

Next up we got some rapid-fire trailers for games like Scott Pilgrim EX (March 3), Another Eden Begins (Summer 2026), Reanimal (February 13), WWE 2K26 (March 13), Star Trek: Voyager – Across the Unknown (February 18), Disney Dreamlight Valley (Switch 2 Edition) (March 25), PGA Tour 2K25 (February 6), Culdcept Begins (July 16), Goat Simulator 3 (April 1), Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun (March 18), and Tales of Arise – Beyond the Dawn Edition (May 22).

Resident Evil Requiem

Resident Evil Requiem is launching on Switch 2 alongside all other current systems on February 27. Folks who have played the game on the console have said it runs pretty well, though it doesn’t look quite as good, so it’s, ya know, a Switch version of a game. Resident Evil VII and Village will also launch on the Switch 2 that same day. Amiibos of Grace and Leon are coming out this summer and will unlock weapon skins in Requiem.

Bethesda is bringing games to Switch 2

Wrapping up the show is Bethesda, which is bringing Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition on February 24, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle on May 12, and The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered later in 2026.



https://kotaku.com/nintendo-direct-february-switch-2-oblivion-fallout-2000665999
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth Wastes No Time Coming To Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
Final Fantasy VII Rebirth will come to Switch 2 just six months after the first game in Square Enix’s remake trilogy arrived on Nintendo’s portable console. It’s also getting a special “boost” mode to help streamline combat.

Out on Switch 2 on June 6, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth follows Cloud and co. after they leave the first game’s Blade Runner-infused megacity of Midgar and head out on an open-world-ish adventure to find Sephiroth and save the world. Its peaks are higher than those of the first game but its troughs are also deeper. The big question will be how well the Switch 2 can handle its much larger environments. Valve’s Steam Deck has more than struggled with the much more sprawling sequel.

Here’s how the game looks in action on Switch 2:

The game will arrive with a new “boost” mode, which I’m guessing will come to the existing versions of the game on other platforms as well. If it’s anything like the new settings added to the Switch 2 version of FFVII Remake Intergrade, it’ll essentially be a combat god mode in which every hit does 9,999 damage and all Materia are maxed out. It’s a way to make the experience almost frictionless for people who might be intimidated by the RPG’s hybrid combat mechanics and just want to get to the next mini-game or cutscene.

The speed at which Rebirth is coming to Switch 2 is the real surprise here. While we’ll have to wait to see just how much it tests Nintendo’s new hardware, the move certainly lends more credence to the possibility that the third game in the remake trilogy, which is reportedly playable and almost finished, won’t be a timed PlayStation 5 exclusive like the others. Hopefully for Switch 2 and Xbox owners, the next game comes to every platform day-and-date.



https://kotaku.com/ff7-rebirth-switch-2-release-date-trailer-rpg-2000666014
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: ARC Raiders Fans Debate Game’s ‘Death’ From ‘Streamer Influence’
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders was released at the end of October, emerging into a blossoming extraction shooter space and making immense waves. It quickly became one of the most successful games of 2025, smashing sales expectations and topping charts worldwide, both in terms of players and viewers.

However, that latter aspect has surfaced in a nasty way in recent days. On social media, the concept of streamers ruining ARC Raiders has gained traction from a debate perspective. Many feel that Embark Studios could be listening too much to streamers, a concern that could lead to the game’s ‘death’.

Will Streamers Ruin ARC Raiders?

In the weeks that followed the launch of ARC Raiders, we saw countless content creators leap head over heels into the game. It made sense, as it was a game that made for excellent content, and for a while, it was one of the most-watched games on Twitch and YouTube.

It even spawned a creator-backed ‘war’ between the likes of Hutch and TheBurntPeanut, which was fun for all of about five minutes.

Now, a comment that surfaced on social media has spawned a somewhat virulent debate, suggesting that ‘try hard, super f***ing losers’ that populate streaming and social spaces will bring about the death of ARC Raiders.

In a post on Twitter (now X), Ghost of Eight wrote:

Call of duty died because they listened to the streamers. H1Z1 died because they tried to make it competitive. Arc Raiders is going to die if they listen to the streamers. Gaming is dead because of streamers and developers listening to social media, which is mostly filled with try hard, super f***ing losers

The post quickly gained traction, racking up hundreds of thousands of impressions and stacks of comments from the community. In one comment, a user stood on the side of the developer, admitting that ‘streamers are the loudest voices in the room, so devs think they represent the majority.’

In another comment, a user bagged on streamers and their fickle, collective mentality: ‘The same streamers that immediately go and play whatever new game is out. These clowns have zero loyalty.’

In recent weeks, ARC Raiders has suffered under the weight of exploits, cheaters, and a slow update cadence that is rewarding players with one new map in five months. Most of the complaints regarding all this come from the streamers that generate audiences in the tens of thousands while playing ARC Raiders.

As another user wrote under Ghost of Eight’s comment:

I agree. Streamers cry to change things like it’s their own personal playground.

Far too often, we see the power of streamers, as one thing commented on by the likes of shroud brings about a major change in a game. Admittedly, it can sometimes be for the better, but the examples are few and far between.

It’s the PvE vs PvP debate all over again. Do you think streamers are ruining ARC Raiders? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Oblivion Remastered is coming to Switch

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Coming to Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion is finally coming to Nintendo consoles. During the Nintendo Direct: Partner Showcase, the final game announced was Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered, which will be coming to the Nintendo Switch 2. It was featured at the end of a sizzle reel highlighting Bethesda games coming to the platform.

Unlike Fallout 4 and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, this game was not given a proper release date. Instead, it was simply noted that it will be released in 2026.

Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion was originally released in 2006. A remastered edition was released on PlayStation and Xbox consoles in 2025. It will now be playable across all major platforms with its Nintendo release.

Elsewhere in the Elder Scrolls universe, the Elder Scrolls Online video game recently received an update, giving it its first paid battle pass system more than a decade after it launched. Learn more here.

The Nintendo Switch 2 Continues to Offer Major Third-Party Games

With releases such as The Elder Scrolls 4, Indiana Jones, and Resident Evil: Requiem, Nintendo Switch 2 continues to push hardware limits and offers a new class of third-party games that would have been difficult to play on the original Nintendo Switch. Players can check out a full list of the games that were announced during the February 5 Nintendo Direct: Partner Showcase at this link.

Are you excited to play Oblivion on the Nintendo Switch 2? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fallout 4 Switch 2 Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
The Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition Switch 2 release date was finally revealed during the Nintendo Direct, arriving on February 24, 2026.

It was already leaked that the upcoming Nintendo Partner Direct will feature release date announcements for Bethesda’s upcoming Switch 2 titles. The report provided us with the physical release date and the pre-order dates for Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle. Now we have the digital release dates as well.

Fallout 4 Releases for Switch 2 This Month

At the latest Nintendo Partner Direct, Bethesda confirmed that Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition for the Switch 2 will release later this month, and players can start pre-ordering the title from today. Bethesda also provided a release date for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, which releases on May 12, 2026, and pre-orders will be available later today. Lastly, we also got a reveal for The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered, coming to the Switch 2 in 2026.

Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition features the post-nuclear journey from the base game, along with the 6 official expansions: Automatron, Wasteland Workshop, Far Harbor, Contraptions Workshop, Vault-Tec Workshop, and Nuka-World. Players also get access to 150 Creation Club items, varying from unique weapons, power armor sets, building packs, paint jobs, one-of-a-kind homes, and more.

In other news, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s Switch 2 release date was also announced at the recent Nintendo Partner Direct. The PlayStation 5 sold more than the Switch 2 in the last quarter. Will you be playing Fallout 4 and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle when they release for the Switch 2? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about PlayStation 5’s holiday stock not being impacted by RAM shortages. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Another Eden Begins announced for Switch 2, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
WFS has announced time-traveling RPG adventure Another Eden Begins for Switch 2, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch this summer.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Embark on a time-traveling RPG adventure featuring command battles presented by Masato Kato, creator of numerous RPG classics. With New Game+, embark on a new adventure with your upgraded characters and discover more than 10 different endings.

Embark on an Adventure Beyond Time and Space

Masato Kato, the creator of numerous RPG classics, presents an epic adventure spanning the past, present, and future! The main story is a richly woven tale with full voice acting, accompanied by a main theme song composed by Yasunori Mitsuda and music incorporating traditional folk instruments and an orchestra by Procyon Studios! Strategic command battles rely on building parties around characters’ roles and synergies to unleash additional skills! Use the power of Another Force to execute devastating attacks and edge closer to victory! After completing the main story, another adventure awaits with New Game+! All of the characters retain their strength for this new journey as actions and choices determine which of over 10 endings will unfold!

Story

Aldo and his younger sister, Feinne, enjoy a peaceful life in the idyllic village of Baruoki, until one day, when Feinne is taken by the Beast King. Aldo pursues them into the Moonlight Forest, but following a fierce battle with a beast, he is sent through a tear in spacetime—and finds himself in a world 800 years in the future.

Encounters and Friendships with 18 Companions

During his adventure across time, Aldo encounters 18 characters with differing backgrounds and talents. Learn more about them through unique encounter quests, character quests, and kinship quests, the last of which becomes available by forging deep connections with them!

Strategic Command Battles

For command battles you initiate, creating a balanced party of attackers, supporters, and healers is key to victory! Unleash attacks to fill the Another Force gauge, and activate Another Force to stop enemies from taking action while your characters deliver devastating attacks!

Embark on a New Adventure with New Game+

Clear the main story to unlock New Game+ and start a new adventure with your characters as they were! With the aid of a mysterious girl who prompts Aldo to undertake this new journey, discover over 10 different endings that unfold based on your actions and choices. A world of new experiences awaits!

Watch the announcement trailer below. Visit the official website here.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/another-eden-begins-announced-for-switch-2-switch-and-pc
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition Emerges On Switch 2 This Month
item.content:encoded:
When Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition launched last November for PlayStation, Xbox, and PC, Bethesda also promised a Switch 2 version would arrive in 2026. Today’s Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase revealed that the game’s Nintendo debut is just a couple of weeks away.

When Fallout 4 arrived on PS4, Xbox One, and PC in 2015, it earned a 9 out of 10 from Game Informer, contributing to an 87 out of 100 on reviews aggregate site Metacritic. This definitive edition of the 2015 open-world RPG includes every post-launch expansion and over 150 pieces of Creation Club content. 

Although Nintendo didn't promote this, the other perk of playing on Switch 2 is the ability to strap the console to your arm like V.A.T.S. to play the game like the coolest person around. Even if that isn't an official feature (and will probably result in you damaging your Switch 2, so please don't try it), the ability to play Fallout 4 on the go through your Nintendo Switch 2 is an exciting proposition, and we'll be able to do just that when Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition arrives on February 24.



https://gameinformer.com/nintendo-direct/2026/02/05/fallout-4-anniversary-edition-emerges-on-switch-2-this-month
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Is Getting A Switch 2 Pro Controller, Grace And Leon Amiibo
item.content:encoded:
Alongside showing off Resident Evil Requiem Switch 2 gameplay during a Nintendo Direct today, Nintendo also announced it is planning to release a few extra goodies alongside the game both for the launch on February 27, and later this summer.

A Resident Evil Requiem-themed Switch 2 Pro Controller will be available the same day as the launch of the game.

Two Amiibo are planned, one for Grace and one for Leon, but those won't be available until the summer. They will apparently unlock weapon skins to be used in game.

Resident Evil Requiem launches on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PC, and Switch 2 on February 27. You can read our hands-on impressions of the Switch 2 version of the game here.



https://gameinformer.com/nintendo-direct/2026/02/05/resident-evil-requiem-is-getting-a-switch-2-pro-controller-grace-and
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: The Adventures Of Elliot: The Millennium Tales Arrives In June
item.content:encoded:
The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales Arrives, the HD-2D Square Enix RPG is coming to Switch 2 on June 18. The game is planned for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, and it will likely launch on those platforms on that date, as well, but that gas bot been 100% confirmed.

Today's new trailer for the game highlighted the various eras Elliot will explore. The Age of Safekeeping is where Elliot is from. The Age of Reconstruction is a time when humans almost went extinct. The Age of magic is when a lot of magic was happening. And the Age of Budding represents the birth of civilization.

Along with meeting new characters and exploring new locations in each era, there are also items and weapons that will be exclusive to each era.



https://gameinformer.com/nintendo-direct/2026/02/05/the-adventures-of-elliot-the-millennium-tales-arrives-in-june
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Stellar mystery adventure Paranormasight is back with a sequel and it's coming to Switch 2 soon
item.content:encoded:
It's a good day for those those interests lie at the intersection of 'spooky' and 'deduction' - Square Enix's acclaimed visual novel Paranormasight is officially getting a sequel and it's coming to Switch 2 later this month, on 19th February.

The original Paranormasight, subtitled The Seven Mysteries of Honjo, launched back in 2023, offering an engaging, intriguing blend of spooks and investigatory adventure, all tied to a story of dark rituals and murder in Tokyo, Japan. "Paranormasight is a delight," reckoned Eurogamer contributor Christian Donlan in his review. "A mystery, a puzzle, and a ghost story that's genuinely haunted by the player on the other side of the screen."

So news of a sequel is exciting indeed, and Square Enix has now shared early details as part of Nintendo's latest Partner Direct. Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse, as it's known, whisks players to coastal Japan, introducing them to a young pearl diver called Yuza Minakuchi who, while diving one day, encounters another version of himself at the bottom of the ocean.

But soon, other mysteries begin to plague the island's inhabitants, and - as the adventure unfolds - you'll talk to them, and explore the bay's depths, to uncover the truth of the Mermaid's Curse.

So there you go. That's Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse, coming to Switch 2 on 19th February.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/stellar-mystery-adventure-paranormasight-is-back-with-a-sequel-and-its-coming-to-switch-2-soon
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is coming to Switch 2 this June
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix has confirmed that Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is coming to Switch 2 on 3rd June 2026, arriving just half a year after the port of the opening entry in the trilogy.

Originally released as a PlayStation 5 exclusive in 2024, it’s great to see Square Enix moving so quickly to bring the middle entry to more platforms.

Looking back on our review at the time, Nic said, “Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is a beautifully crafted experience that fans old and new will absolutely love. It almost goes too far in correcting the first game’s linearity with broad open areas stuffed with things to do, but there’s also key additions to the combat, and the story running through this middle chapter is masterfully retold. Really the biggest problem you’ll have once the credits roll is knowing that it will be far too many years before we can finish the trilogy.”

We have high hopes of how this game will perform. In our review of the first port, Dom said, “The Nintendo Switch 2 version of Final Fantasy VII Remake Integrade arrives in stunning form, with very few compromises made bringing it across to Nintendo’s newest hardware. It’s an essential purchase for RPG fans who haven’t had the chance to play this reimagined saga.”



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2026/02/05/final-fantasy-vii-rebirth-is-coming-to-switch-2-this-june/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Orbitals looks like a 90s anime It Takes Two, coming exclusively to Switch 2 this summer
item.content:encoded:
Reappearing during the Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase, Orbitals is coming exclusively to Nintendo Switch 2 in Summer 2026, and it looks like an early 90s anime riff on the beloved It Takes Two style co-op adventure.

The graphical style really shines through here, really capturing the look and feel of classic Japanese animation to go alongside the familiar looking split-screen co-op. The game sees explorers Maki and Omura setting out from their home to try and save it from an impending cosmic storm. They’ll be making use of separate abilities to support each others’ adventuring, using things like a grapple gun to pull out platforms, or cool lava with a water gun.

The game can also be played across multiple systems using GameShare, so you don’t have to play on TV or with a single Joy-Con.

Announced back at The Game Awards (where we sadly missed its reveal), the game is in development by Tokyo-based indie team Shapefarm, but with assistance from animation house Studio Massket to craft its cutscenes. The game will have both Japanese and English audio dubs.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2026/02/05/orbitals-looks-like-a-90s-anime-it-takes-two-coming-exclusively-to-switch-2-this-summer/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

Get cracking on Remake, folks!

Square Enix has announced that Final Fantasy VII Rebirth will launch on Switch 2 on 3rd June 2026.

The direct sequel to Final Fantasy VII Remake takes out heroes out into an "open world" of sorts as they explore the environments outside of Midgar. It was originally released back in 2024 and is directed by Naoki Hamaguchi, who is also handling development on the untitled third entry.

item.title: GeForce NOW Turns Six (Users Streamed Over 1B Hours to Date); 24 New Games Coming This Month
item.content:encoded:
NVIDIA's GeForce NOW cloud gaming service is turning six this month. As you might recall, it launched right as the COVID-19 pandemic started spreading globally in February 2020. The service has undoubtedly greatly improved over the last few years, convincing more publishers to bring their games to the cloud and also continuously improving the backend technology to raise the bar for cloud gaming, as they did a few months ago with the RTX Blackwell upgrade.

NVIDIA took the opportunity to confirm that GFN users have streamed over one billion hours of gameplay to date. Given the ongoing memory shortage, it wouldn't be surprising to see even more gamers turning to the cloud to play on PC.

Anyway, to celebrate the anniversary, NVIDIA is adding 24 PC games to the supported GeForce NOW list this month, starting this week with the following titles:

  • Indika (New release on Xbox, available on Game Pass, Feb. 3)
  • Menace (New release on Steam and Xbox, available on Game Pass, Feb. 5, GeForce RTX 5080-ready)
  • World of Warcraft: Burning Crusade Classic Anniversary Edition (New release on Battle.net, Feb. 5)
  • PUBG: BLINDSPOT (New release on Steam, Feb. 5, GeForce RTX 5080-ready)
  • Carmageddon: Rogue Shift (New release on Steam, Feb. 6, GeForce RTX 5080-ready)
  • Delta Force (Steam)
  • Fallout Shelter (Steam)
  • Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition (Steam and Xbox, available on Game Pass)
  • Roadcraft (Xbox, available on Game Pass)
  • Wildgate (Epic Games Store)

The best is yet to come, though, with CAPCOM's Resident Evil Requiem undoubtedly set to be the most played GeForce NOW game when it launches in late February. Here's the rest of the February 2026 list:

  • Disciples: Domination (New release on Steam, Feb. 12)
  • REANIMAL (New release on Steam, Feb. 13)
  • Kingdom Come Deliverance (New release on Xbox, available on Game Pass Feb. 13)
  • Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora (New release on Xbox, available on Game Pass Feb. 17)
  • Norse: Oath of Blood (New release on Steam, Feb. 17)
  • Star Trek: Voyager - Across the Unknown (New release on Steam, Feb. 18)
  • Styx: Blades of Greed (New release on Steam, Feb. 19)
  • Ys X: Proud Nordics (New release on Steam, Feb. 20)
  • Resident Evil: Requiem (New release on Steam, Feb. 26)
  • Arc Raiders (Xbox)
  • DEVOUR (Steam)
  • Torque Drift 2 (Steam)
  • Trine 3: The Artifacts of Power (Epic Games Store)
  • Trine 4: The Nightmare Prince (Epic Games Store)

NVIDIA also confirmed that the co-op isometric open world zombie survival game Humanitz is GeForce RTX 5080-ready. Additionally, the upcoming city-building game Nova Roma, due to launch on March 26, 2026, will be streamable via GeForce NOW on day one.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/geforce-now-turns-six-users-streamed-over-1b-hours-to-date/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Fallout TV: Is New Vegas Canon Anymore?
item.content:encoded:
If there were ever a sure bet in life, it's that a video game adaptation will always make someone unhappy. As it turns out, translating a game from an interactive format with no defined time constraint to a non-interactive medium with a limited view time means that some concessions need to be made. In the case of the Fallout TV show, there's an extra problem in that it takes place after Fallout: New Vegas, a beloved entry in the franchise with a lot of potential player-defined endings.

You obviously can't please everyone due to how each of the endings could potentially have massive in-universe consequences. Thus the billion dollar question is which ending did the Fallout TV show go with, or did the writers make up a new ending entirely? Perhaps the best way to answer that would be to examine the status of the Wasteland's major powers as presented by the show.

MAJOR SPOILERS AHEAD

Fallout TV | The Brotherhood of Steel

Unsurprisingly, the Brotherhood of Steel has the most screen time of any of the major factions in the Fallout TV show. The fact that Maximus, one of the main characters of the show, is a member of the Brotherhood means that we get a lot of insight into what the faction has been up to since the end of Fallout: New Vegas. Interestingly enough, the Fallout TV show makes a distinction between both individual Brotherhood chapters and the larger Commonwealth and West Coast divisions of the Brotherhood.

The Commonwealth Brotherhood of Steel faction is pretty much a direct continuation of the Brotherhood from Fallout 3 and Fallout 4. At this time, the show suggests that the writers are going with either the Minutemen or Brotherhood ending of Fallout 4. That being said, the Fallout TV show states that the Commonwealth Brotherhood is having some hard times, insinuating that their war with the Institute and possibly the Railroad expended a lot of manpower and resources.

The West Coast Brotherhood of Steel division is represented by Maximus' chapter and three other Brotherhood chapters. Interestingly enough, the Fallout: New Vegas Brotherhood chapter is nowhere to be found. Given that the show would take place in their backyard, one would logically conclude that this particular chapter was rendered non-existent, either directly as per the game's endings or indirectly as a result of their isolation and potential hostility to most of the major players in the region.

Unfortunately for the Brotherhood of Steel as a whole, they are in the midst of a massive civil war. The West Coast chapters have already started fighting each other, and the Commonwealth-based Brotherhood would almost certainly not be happy that their representative was killed at a meeting organized by the West Coast chapters. To make matters worse, whoever comes out on top on the West Coast will control Area 51 and all of its pre-war tech, guaranteeing that this civil war will be incredibly destructive.

Fallout TV | The NCR

While the NCR has been portrayed favorably by the Fallout TV show, the state of the NCR in New Vegas is dire. Indeed, one of the major plot points of the show is that although the NCR was on a path to relative normalcy, the destruction of Shady Sands has contributed to the NCR's current diminished state. 

The small pockets of NCR soldiers that we do see in the show are invariably under-supplied, disorganized, and isolated. Even if the show writers decided to go with the NCR ending of Fallout: New Vegas, it is mostly for naught as their military has withdrawn from the New Vegas area. That the NCR's local detachment of elite Rangers have been reduced to glorified scavengers bodes poorly for a faction that, by all accounts, should have reasonably sturdy logistics and communications systems.

It should probably be noted that Freeside's inhabitants appear to be quite fond of the NCR. This all but confirms that the NCR had conquered New Vegas for a decent amount of time and then withdrew. If this is the case, then the likelihood of a Pyrrhic NCR victory at the end of New Vegas increases dramatically. 

This is further reinforced by the finale as a full NCR detachment finally shows up, complete with Veteran Rangers and fresh-looking gear. The difference cannot be any more stark as this group is clearly organized and disciplined enough to reclaim Freeside without much trouble. While it remains to be seen if this is indicative of the overall status of the NCR, the fact remains that the manpower and equipment had to come from somewhere. Not to mention the time it would've taken to muster such a force and then march to Freeside.

Fallout TV | Caesar's Legion

In a rather amusing historical parallel, Caesar's Legion is experiencing a civil war after Caesar's death. While the Fallout TV show doesn't specify how Caesar died, the fact that both sides of the civil war are fighting over his not so fresh corpse almost certainly means that Caesar's tumor killed him. 

Regardless, Caesar's death and the subsequent civil war all but guarantees that the Legion ending of Fallout: New Vegas is not canon. In fact, it is explicitly stated that if the Legion won the battle for Hoover Dam while Caesar is dead, then Legate Lanius is crowned as the new Caesar. It makes little sense for that to change just because Caesar dies after the Legion conquers New Vegas. In fact, Lanius is never mentioned in the show at all, which would make even less sense if the Legion won.

One can go so far as to imagine a scenario where Lanius suffered a similar fate to Joshua Graham, punished for failing to conquer New Vegas and forgotten by the Legion. Otherwise you would have to explain how the Legate would allow a civil war with two self proclaimed Caesars to break out, leading to a third, completely different Caesar to be crowned and only then finally rallying the Legion to "reclaim" New Vegas.

Fallout TV | Mr. House and New Vegas

The New Vegas Strip finally makes its onscreen debut, and one of the first things that Mr. House says is that things did not go according to plan. For starters, the Strip and all of its casinos are abandoned. To make matters worse, Deathclaws have moved in relatively recently and turned the area into their nest. There clearly isn't an army of upgraded Securitrons on the Strip, active or otherwise, and there didn't appear to be any signs of conflict regardless.

Freeside on the other hand appears to be thriving. Granted, Fallout: New Vegas' portrayal of Freeside wasn't exactly flattering, but that is more of an issue with hardware limitations than artistic intent. At the very least, it's implied that Freeside is important enough for both the NCR and Legion to have fought for control of the area, with neither side ultimately prevailing over the other before the "robots" and Deathclaws moved in next door. 

As unfortunate as it may be that some of the Kings were Ghoulified in the Fallout TV show, it does shed some light upon the possible canon ending of Fallout: New Vegas. The Legion endings can be ruled out as they explicitly wipe out the Kings no matter what. A Mr. House ending is an option, yet it doesn't explain why the Strip is abandoned. The Independent New Vegas scenarios match the state of Freeside better, though it must've collapsed quickly as it's explicitly stated that the NCR and Legion controlled the area long enough to implement some form of taxation. 

Fallout TV | The Enclave and Vault-Tec

As one would've expected from the games, the remnants of the pre-war United States government are specters haunting the wasteland. Although the Enclave has the least amount of screen time of all the major factions, they are directly named and still active by the time of the Fallout TV show. To no one's surprise, the Enclave are doing evil things again and it's almost certainly leading to direct conflict in future seasons of the Fallout TV show.

As far as the Vaults are concerned, they have begun falling into the usual problems. Some are on the verge of running out of resources, others have collapsed due to the experiments being conducted in them, and some have (unintentionally) saved their inhabitants as advertised. Unfortunately for the show's named Vault dwellers, FEV is really being pushed to the forefront this season and we all know how much Vault-Tec loves to store bio-hazardous material in a safe and secure location.

Which Fallout: New Vegas Ending Is Canon?

The writers for Fallout TV's season 2 may not have explicitly chosen any particular Fallout: New Vegas ending to make canon, but there's just enough clues to glean out two possible scenarios. The first possibility is that the writers went with the NCR ending. However, the NCR couldn't maintain control over the area and the destruction of Shady Sands prompted their withdrawal from New Vegas. The other likely scenario is that New Vegas won their independence for a while. Yet a handful of Securitrons can only do so much when a city is caught between two competing nation states.

While this is a rather nihilistic viewpoint, it's not entirely unrealistic. Fallout: New Vegas itself points out that the Courier is not able to fix the wasteland on their own. It doesn't matter if you have the perfect playthrough, you're not solving the NCR's institutional rot. There's nothing preventing an independent New Vegas from falling into anarchy once the credits roll either. Even in the event that Mr. House or the Legion won, the Courier is still treated as a useful pawn, nothing more.

It's a not so subtle rebuke of the great man theory, though that still doesn't explain why every major faction imploded at the same time. The simplest answer might be that Bethesda wants to avoid a scenario where any game's ending could snowball into the creation of a wasteland superpower. 

We can already see hints of this with the Commonwealth Brotherhood of Steel. They went from being the savior of the Capital Wasteland in Fallout 3 to potentially the dominant East coast faction. According to the TV show, the Commonwealth Brotherhood now has credible force projection capabilities that can reach the West Coast as well. At that point, you'd be hard pressed to ignore them in the narrative of future games, especially if old world technology is involved.

With that in mind, perhaps the show is leveling the playing field in preparation for Fallout 5. Bethesda might have decided that they want to explore all of the United States in the next Fallout game, so it would be helpful if there wasn't one overwhelmingly powerful faction outside of the Enclave. If anything, the Fallout TV show's finale has more or less set up the perfect background for Fallout 5 (whenever that releases). You've got a coast-to-coast Brotherhood of Steel civil war, a resurgent NCR and Legion fighting over New Vegas again, the Enclave, and Mr. House all on the board as potential questlines that probably won't be fully resolved by the TV show.

Anson is a Writer at TechRaptor and has been playing games for as long as he can remember. As far as he's concerned, games are one of the greatest forms of… More about Anson



https://techraptor.net/gaming/opinions/fallout-tv-is-new-vegas-canon-anymore
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: One Of 2025’s Biggest Flops Is Trying To Engineer A Big Comeback Almost No One Asked For
item.content:encoded:
Developer Build a Rocket Boy might be trying to stage a No Man’s Sky-level comeback story for its heavily maligned, frequently mocked 2025 open-world game MindsEye, and it would appear that the developer is attempting to do so without the help of its original publisher, IO Interactive.

This week, MindsEye received an unexpected new update. Build a Rocket Boy touts Update 7 as “another step forward in overall polish, guided by player and community feedback.” That statement does line up with the contents of the patch itself, as Update 7 essentially amounts to a list of bug fixes.

However, the patch notes were followed up by a much grander statement in an official press release. According to Build a Rocket Boy, Update 7 serves “as a reset for the brand and the title” and the beginning of a “new era” for MindsEye. This statement lines up with the omission of IO Interactive’s branding and copyright info in the latest trailer for the game, which seemingly proves that the leak detailing Build a Rocket Boy and IO Interactive’s split was correct.

It’s not been a great week, month, or year for MindsEye. At the end of January, it leaked that Build a Rocket Boy would reportedly be parting ways with IO Interactive, ending any plans for MindsEye’s future Hitman crossover. On February 2, co-CEO Mark Gerhard threatened a YouTuber with a “formal cease and desist demand” via Discord 18 minutes after said YouTuber released a video titled “Leslie Benzies is in the Epstein Files.” Then, yesterday, Build a Rocket Boy’s other CEO, the aforementioned Leslie Benzies, released a statement denying allegations of sexual assault by an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

Build a Rocket Boy confirmed that Benzies remains working at the studio despite a wave of layoffs last summer, suggesting MindsEye’s attempt at a reboot will happen under his oversight. This week’s tease promised that a “new expansion that adds end-game content and enhanced world exploration” and multiplayer support are on the way, with details regarding the fresh 2026 content roadmap to be revealed “within the coming months.”



https://kotaku.com/mindseye-reboot-update-7-leslie-benzies-2000666008
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth Switch 2 Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix finally announced the release date for Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth for the Switch 2 at the latest Nintendo Partner Direct, and it arrives on June 3, 2026.

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth has been awaited for the Switch 2 ever since the first instalment was released this year, and the developers have come through with the announcement. It was rumoured that the game would be showcased for the console at the Direct, along with a release date.

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth for Switch 2 Releases June 2026

It was confirmed during the latest Nintendo Partner Direct that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth will release for the Switch 2 this June. Interested readers can pre-order the title later today. All we need now from Square Enix is an official reveal for the next part, Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3; they already have a title in mind.

For those unaware, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is the second part of the remake trilogy, where Cloud and the party set foot on a new adventure after escaping the city of Mako. Now players can explore a wider world, featuring grassy plains atop chocobos. The story features characters like Zack Fair, Sephiroth, and more, while you face a threat to the planet itself.

In other news, the original Final Fantasy 7 is re-releasing on Steam. Additionally, Rebirth and Part 3 have also been confirmed for Xbox. Are you going to be playing Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth on the Switch 2 once it releases this June? Are you one of the readers who might pre-order the title today? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Starfield reportedly releasing for the PlayStation 5 in April 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

MOBILE APP

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

item.title: Best Ninjutsu You Need To Use In Nioh 3—Best Ninjutsu Class, Explained
item.content:encoded:
You should not underestimate the power of Ninjutsu under any circumstances in Nioh 3. If a boss is performing a big attack, leaving you cowering, you should be hurling some Ninjutsu its way to deal damage and maybe even immobilize it.

Ninjutsu is the secondary aspect of the Ninja style in Nioh 3. Samurai is all about hitting hard; Ninja is about hitting often. Another way to inflict damage (or disable) is by using the best Ninjutsu weapons and gear.

Best Ninjutsu You Should Use In Nioh 3

Burrow is hands down the best Ninjutsu ability you need to equip in Nioh 3.

Nioh 3 becomes a different game once you unlock and equip Burrow. Tired of unmissable Boss attacks hitting you? Tired of being struck by those sneaky, irritating combos you can’t remember the sequence for and don’t know how to deal with? Are you also tired of getting hit by annoying mob enemies when you just want to get past? Burrow is the answer.

  • More Insider Gaming: Nioh 3 Review: The Best Soulslike You Will Play In 2026

This is an absolute game-changer and lifesaver in one. We all know how difficult it can be to dodge or evade a boss’ grab attacks. Why try to dodge when you can quite literally vanish for a few seconds underground? Not only that, but you can emerge behind the enemy and deal extra damage.

It’s much handier for boss fights than it is for general exploration, so bear this in mind. It might be worthwhile swapping it out for something else in the meantime. But given that the biggest timesink will undoubtedly be bosses, Burrow is the clear favorite here.

Best Ninjutsu Setup In Nioh 3

You get three slots to use in your Ninjutsu setup for Nioh 3, and you should be using Burrow, Cicada Shell, and the Paralysis Shuriken.

  • More Insider Gaming: Nioh 3 Trophy List—How To Get All Achievements & Trophies & Difficulty Rating

This is the best Ninjutsu setup by default. Now, is it an imperative in every situation? Absolutely not, but these are the best three to have together, so let’s explain why.

Burrow

Pretty much see above. There is few very circumstances where Burrow won’t save your life, give you some kind of advantage, or get you somewhere quicker by evading or sidestepping a mob. It’s the best Ninjutsu, and given what it does, it seems a natural fit for the bottom slot.

Cicada Shell

You might sense that we’re putting defense and self-preservation as more important factors than offense, and you would be correct. Cicada Shell makes it so that once activated, if you get hit, you will teleport behind the enemy. This is another defensive solution that can get you out of a fix and help you deliver some cheap shots.

Paralysis Shuriken

This one is fairly interchangeable depending on the opponent. If you’re facing a boss, paralyzing them is always a HUGE benefit. Anything that immobilizes a foe, slows them down, and generally gives you a chance to get in some free shots needs to be utilized to the fullest. Plus, if you can synergize the paralysis infliction with gear or Accessories, it will speed up and prolong the effect.

If the boss has a certain weakness, then maybe the fire version of the Shuriken should be equipped, and so on.

If you’ve played Nioh 3, let us know if our Ninjutsu picks worked for you, or if there’s a trick being missed. Let the team know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server, which is free to join.

Please check out more Nioh 3 guides: Best Weapons to use, how to get more Elixirs, and our complete Warring States Map showing all collectibles.

item.title: All YAPYAP Monsters & How to Deal With Them
item.content:encoded:
YAPYAP isn’t just about casting Spells and causing chaos, as there are plenty of monsters to avoid and counter, some of which are truly terrifying.

Monsters in YAPYAP come in a variety of forms, ranging from the frustrating, but easily defeatable, to powerful Monsters that will quickly end any run if you encounter them.

For tips on how to counter every monster in YAPYAP, Insider Gaming has you covered, and more monsters will be added to this article when counters are discovered.

All YAPYAP Monsters

Goblins

The biggest threat posed by Goblins is if they overwhelm you with their numbers, but they can easily be kept at bay by using the Aero Spell with the Wand of Winds. This doesn’t eliminate their threat entirely, however, but there’s an easy way to do that.

With the Grotesque Wand, cast Fish-Yuk at a Goblin to turn them into a fish, which can then be picked up and moved, and you can throw them off the edge into the abyss. If there’s no edge nearby, turning them into fish still allows for a quick getaway.

Guards

Red Knight Guards are one of the most powerful monsters in YAPYAP and can eliminate you with just a couple of hits. They do have weaknesses; however, if you have the right tools in your arsenal, knocking their helmet off is a great way to earn extra Chaos.

Be quiet around the Guards, as they are attracted to your voice, and loop around them to create space, as they are slow movers. With the Wand of Illusions, you can cast the Float Oculus spell and take over a Guard, moving them out of the way, or attacking other monsters with them to clear an area.

The Wand of Illusions can also be used to cast a duplicate of yourself with the Echo Me Spell, which is an easy way to distract the Guards, and the Fish-Yuk Spell can turn Guards into Fish, but there’s a limited time to get rid of them before it transforms back.

The Eye

The Eye has an annoying habit of spawning in areas where there is limited room, making it hard to avoid its ranged attack that quickly blitzes through your health bar, but thankfully, it is a static enemy that can’t move.

Breaking the line of sight with The Eye disables its attack, so jump behind anything you can to neutralize it, with walls and pillars being the best options. Once the line of sight has been erased, The Eye will disappear, but it isn’t gone completely and will, more than likely, return.

While it’s not too difficult to avoid The Eye, the real danger comes when it serves as a distraction with other monsters in the area, so be alert. It’s another monster that you can turn into a fish, but there is a short period of time to get rid of it.

The Slime

The Slime is a slow-moving cube of jelly that is mostly harmless, as the damage it deals is low, but getting trapped inside the cube will slow you down majorly, making you easy pickings for another monster.

Though they are mostly easy to avoid, unless they’re blocking your exit, they’re also easy to defeat using the Piss-Yuk Spell with the Grotesque Wand, so cast the Spell and make sure to keep a constant flow of noise to increase the rate of urination.

Unlike other enemies, The Slime cannot be transformed into a Fish.

Spider

The Spider is one of the most terrifying monsters in all of YAPYAP, and the best point of action is to just avoid it entirely. Keep an ear out for scuttling sounds, which are a big indicator that an eight-legged freak is nearby, and navigate cautiously.

That’s all well and good, but sometimes there is no avoiding the Spider. In these instances, the Wand of Fire is the best bet, as it can deal decent damage with Ignis Breath and Ignis Doom, but the most valuable Spell is Ignis Legs, providing a speed boost to help you escape.

Turning the Spider into a fish with the Fish-Yuk spell is an option, but the duration is very short, so use any time to escape and don’t try to pick the fish up.

Mimic

The Mimic can easily catch you off guard, as it will take the form of you or a teammate, but it is relatively easy to defeat, with most Spels that deal damage effective against them.

Similar to Goblins, the Fish-Yuk Spell with the Grotesque Wand is an easy option, turning them into fish that you can throw off the edge of the map into the abyss, but any damage-dealing spell with the Wand of Fire is similarly effective.

Gargoyles

Gargoyles fall into the same sort of category as Mimics and Goblins, as they’re not too challenging when isolated and can be easily defeated with the Fish-Yuk approach and hauling them off the edge of the world.

The biggest threat posed by Gargoyles is the potential jump scare, as they will start off looking like any Gargoyle statue on the map before springing to life. As such, take good care around these objects, and be ready to fight back.

Time Ghost

There is no defeating the Time Ghost, which appears when you and your teammates run out of time, and it will kill you instantly, and there’s no counter.

Instead, keep a close eye on the countdown at the top-left of the screen, which indicates how much time you have left, and ensure you extract before the timer reaches zero.

What tips would you give other players to deal with monsters in YAPYAP? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, take a look at the full 2026 Roadmap for Overwatch, and check out the full achievement and trophy list for Nioh 3.
